SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
COMMERCE MARKETPLACE
Accounts and Users

To create an account in a Marketplace, a seller must pass through your approval process. The approval process starts with the seller’s registration that can be done by you or the seller.

Seller Registration
Only registered users can access the features of the seller portal. You can manually register a seller, or the seller can register themselves through the seller portal. When a seller self-registers, they create a login with their name and email address. The seller can then complete the registration process at any time. You can track the seller’s registration and set up email notifications to follow the seller’s progress.
Register a Seller Portal User Manually
You can register a seller portal user manually by creating a contact, associating it with a seller account, and promoting the contact to a user.
Deactivate a Seller Portal User
Deactivating a user allows you to suspend their access to the Seller Portal and reclaim their Customer Community Plus license. Deactivation preserves the record of the user and gives you the option to reactivate them later.
Configure Seller's Self-Registration
Configure the self-registration capability for Commerce Marketplace sellers
View a Seller’s Self-Registration Application
You can track a prospect’s progress in registering to be a seller on your marketplace and verify their eligibility.
Customize the Seller Approval Flow
You can customize the approval stages and apply different rules for approval.
Set Up Seller Registration Status Emails
You can get email notifications regarding the seller’s registration status.
